channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can OpenAI Respond After Google Closes the A.I. Technology Gap?
item.description: A new technology release from OpenAI is supposed to top what Google recently produced. It also shows OpenAI is engaged in a new and more difficult com...

item.title: Bessent Accelerates Regulation Overhaul to Jumpstart Growth
item.description: The Treasury Secretary unveiled changes to the Financial Stability Oversight Council to ease “overregulation.”

item.title: RFK Jr. and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy had a pull-up competition at Reagan to announce Trump’s $1 billion plan for healthy airport upgrades
item.description: Officials were vague about what these upgrades could include.

item.title: OpenAI and Disney just ended the ‘war’ between AI and Hollywood with their $1 billion Sora deal—and OpenAI made itself ‘indispensable,’ expert says
item.description: “Google has YouTube. OpenAI now has the Magic Kingdom,” copyright expert Matthew Sag said.

item.title: What Does the Oil Tanker Seizure Mean for Venezuela’s Economy?
item.description: Seizures of more tankers could put a stranglehold on Venezuela’s economy, which is exceptionally dependent on oil to keep the government running and p...

item.title: ‘Creativity is the new productivity’: Bob Iger on why Disney chose to be ‘aggressive,’ adding OpenAI as a $1 billion partner
item.description: "We'd rather participate in the rather dramatic growth, rather than just watching it happen and essentially being disrupted by it," Iger told CNBC.

item.title: Bob Iger says Disney’s $1 billion deal with OpenAI is an ‘opportunity, not a threat’: ‘We’d rather participate than be disrupted by it’
item.description: The three-year deal will bring more than 200 Disney characters to Sora.

item.title: Zelensky Says Revised U.S. Plan Still Calls for Ukraine to Leave Donbas
item.description: The Ukrainian leader rejected the demand, making clear that territorial issues remain unresolved as Ukraine and Europe sent a counterproposal to the U...

item.title: A Grand Jury Again Resists Trump’s Push to Re-Indict Letitia James
item.description: It was a striking rejection of the administration’s retribution campaign.

item.title: OpenAI aims to silence concerns it is falling behind in the AI race with release of new model GPT-5.2
item.description: OpenAI said its new model outperforms those from rivals Google and Anthropic across a wide range of evaluations.

item.title: Flooding in British Columbia Forces Highway Closures
item.description: The atmospheric river over the Pacific Northwest brought a deluge to British Columbia, forcing road closures and evacuations in Canada.

item.title: Hamas Committed War Crimes in 2023 Attack on Israel, Amnesty International Says
item.description: The rights group said it had documented atrocities committed by Palestinian armed groups, including murder, imprisonment, torture and sexual violence.

item.title: Here’s What to Know About Japan’s Mega Quake Advisory
item.description: Japan’s government says that the chances of a magnitude 8 earthquake have increased. Scientists can’t predict when one will strike, but it represents ...

item.title: What Does the Oil Tanker Seizure Mean for Venezuela’s Economy?
item.description: Seizures of more tankers could put a stranglehold on Venezuela’s economy, which is exceptionally dependent on oil to keep the government running and p...

item.title: African Treasures Return Home
item.description: The Benin Bronzes, taken from what is now Nigeria, have become a symbol in the effort to return looted artifacts to their home countries.
